confusion_pairs.title: Control Category vs Control Type

a.definition: Where/how the control acts (technical, operational, managerial, physical).

b.definition: The intent/effect (preventive, deterrent, detective, corrective, compensating, directive).

bullets: One control can have both a category and a type.

confusion_pairs.title: Deterrent vs Preventive

b.definition: Stops or blocks the action (encryption, ACLs).

bullets: A warning sign is deterrent, not preventive.
Full-disk encryption is preventive for data exposure.

confusion_pairs.title: Data States (At Rest / In Transit / In Use)

b.definition: Moving over networks / being processed in memory.

bullets: Protect all three states, not just transit.
In-use data can be exposed via memory scraping.
At-rest data requires storage encryption and access controls.

confusion_pairs.title: Segmentation vs Isolation

b.definition: Cut off from outside networks completely.

bullets: Segmentation still allows limited traffic by rules.
Isolation is often compensating for high-risk exceptions.

confusion_pairs.title: Hashing vs Encryption

a.definition: One-way transformation used for integrity checks.

b.definition: Reversible transformation using a key for confidentiality.

bullets: Hashing is not reversible like encryption.
Hashes can be attacked via guessing/brute force.
Encryption protects confidentiality; hashing proves integrity.

control_category_technical.rule: If it acts in the digital/IT layer (firewalls, encryption), it is technical.

control_type_detective.rule: Detective controls identify events that already happened.

control_type_preventive.rule: Preventive controls block or stop incidents.
control_type_preventive.micro_example: Full-disk encryption helps prevent data disclosure.

control_type_deterrent.rule: Deterrent controls discourage attempts rather than blocking them.
control_type_deterrent.micro_example: Warning signs and fences are deterrent.

data_state_in_transit.rule: Data moving over a network is in transit; think TLS or VPN.
data_state_in_transit.micro_example: Unencrypted service-to-service traffic is in transit.

data_state_in_use.rule: Data being processed in memory is in use and can be scraped.
data_state_in_use.micro_example: API tokens stolen from RAM are in use exposure.

data_state_at_rest.rule: Data stored on disk or backups is at rest.
data_state_at_rest.micro_example: Database files on a laptop are at rest.

segmentation.rule: Segmentation separates networks but allows controlled communication.
segmentation.micro_example: Finance VLAN reachable only through strict rules is segmented.

isolation.rule: Isolation removes outside network access entirely.
isolation.micro_example: Legacy system on an air-gapped network is isolated.

hashing.rule: Hashing is for integrity, not confidentiality.
hashing.micro_example: Compare file hashes to detect tampering.
